history.content: As I'm graduating, I realize that I'm interested in taking more systems-based classes that will teach me about how distributed systems and things like zookeepers/daemons/etc. work. I took 186 and 162 and I'm taking 168. I have had more experience in machine learning compared to this, so I'm very interested in advice from people for classes/books/lectures on this material.
history.subject: Recommendations for Books or classes on Distributed Systems (or non-monolithic systems)
